00050 // Define groups for Doxygen documentation
00060 // Simple text that is displayed on the main page of Doxygen documentation.
00102 // Define preprocessor symbols used to determine architecture
00103 #if _WIN32||_WIN64
00104 #   if defined(_M_X64)||defined(__x86_64__)  // the latter for MinGW support
00105 #       define __TBB_x86_64 1
00106 #   elif defined(_M_IA64)
00107 #       define __TBB_ipf 1
00108 #   elif defined(_M_IX86)||defined(__i386__) // the latter for MinGW support
00109 #       define __TBB_x86_32 1
00110 #   endif
00111 #else /* Assume generic Unix */
00112 #   if !__linux__ && !__APPLE__
00113 #       define __TBB_generic_os 1
00114 #   endif
00115 #   if __x86_64__
00116 #       define __TBB_x86_64 1
00117 #   elif __ia64__
00118 #       define __TBB_ipf 1
00119 #   elif __i386__||__i386  // __i386 is for Sun OS
00120 #       define __TBB_x86_32 1
00121 #   else
00122 #       define __TBB_generic_arch 1
00123 #   endif
00124 #endif

00202 #if _MSC_VER && _MSC_VER<1600
00203     namespace internal {
00204         typedef __int8 int8_t;
00205         typedef __int16 int16_t;
00206         typedef __int32 int32_t;
00207         typedef __int64 int64_t;
00208         typedef unsigned __int8 uint8_t;
00209         typedef unsigned __int16 uint16_t;
00210         typedef unsigned __int32 uint32_t;
00211         typedef unsigned __int64 uint64_t;
00212     } // namespace internal
00213 #else /* Posix */
00214     namespace internal {
00215         using ::int8_t;
00216         using ::int16_t;
00217         using ::int32_t;
00218         using ::int64_t;
00219         using ::uint8_t;
00220         using ::uint16_t;
00221         using ::uint32_t;
00222         using ::uint64_t;
00223     } // namespace internal
00224 #endif /* Posix */

00277 template<class T, int S>
00278 struct padded_base : T {
00279     char pad[NFS_MaxLineSize - sizeof(T) % NFS_MaxLineSize];
00280 };
00281 template<class T> struct padded_base<T, 0> : T {};
00282 
00284 template<class T>
00285 struct padded : padded_base<T, sizeof(T)> {};

00290 #define __TBB_offsetof(class_name, member_name) \
00291     ((ptrdiff_t)&(reinterpret_cast<class_name*>(0x1000)->member_name) - 0x1000)
00292 
00294 #define __TBB_get_object_ref(class_name, member_name, member_addr) \
00295     (*reinterpret_cast<class_name*>((char*)member_addr - __TBB_offsetof(class_name, member_name)))

00300 #if TBB_USE_EXCEPTIONS
00301     #define __TBB_TRY try
00302     #define __TBB_CATCH(e) catch(e)
00303     #define __TBB_THROW(e) throw e
00304     #define __TBB_RETHROW() throw
00305 #else /* !TBB_USE_EXCEPTIONS */
00306     inline bool __TBB_false() { return false; }
00307     #define __TBB_TRY
00308     #define __TBB_CATCH(e) if ( tbb::internal::__TBB_false() )
00309     #define __TBB_THROW(e) ((void)0)
00310     #define __TBB_RETHROW() ((void)0)
00311 #endif /* !TBB_USE_EXCEPTIONS */

00316 #if TBB_USE_ASSERT
00317 static void* const poisoned_ptr = reinterpret_cast<void*>(-1);
00318 
00320 template<typename T>
00321 inline void poison_pointer( T*& p ) { p = reinterpret_cast<T*>(poisoned_ptr); }
00322 
00324 template<typename T>
00325 inline bool is_poisoned( T* p ) { return p == reinterpret_cast<T*>(poisoned_ptr); }
00326 #else
00327 template<typename T>
00328 inline void poison_pointer( T* ) {/*do nothing*/}
00329 #endif /* !TBB_USE_ASSERT */

00334 template<typename T, typename U> 
00335 inline T punned_cast( U* ptr ) {
00336     uintptr_t x = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(ptr);
00337     return reinterpret_cast<T>(x);
00338 }

00341 class no_assign {
00342     // Deny assignment
00343     void operator=( const no_assign& );
00344 public:
00345 #if __GNUC__
00347     no_assign() {}
00348 #endif /* __GNUC__ */
00349 };
00350 
00352 class no_copy: no_assign {
00354     no_copy( const no_copy& );
00355 public:
00357     no_copy() {}
00358 };

00361 template<typename T>
00362 struct allocator_type {
00363     typedef T value_type;
00364 };
00365 
00366 #if _MSC_VER
00368 template<typename T>
00369 struct allocator_type<const T> {
00370     typedef T value_type;
00371 };
00372 #endif
00373 
00375 inline size_t size_t_select( unsigned u, unsigned long long ull ) {
00376     /* Explicit cast of the arguments to size_t is done to avoid compiler warnings
00377        (e.g. by Clang and MSVC) about possible truncation. The value of the right size,
00378        which is selected by ?:, is anyway not truncated or promoted.
00379        MSVC still warns if this trick is applied directly to constants, hence this function. */
00380     return (sizeof(size_t)==sizeof(u)) ? size_t(u) : size_t(ull);
00381 }
